newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian PM's office denies Gujral has resigned.
newsitem.headline: Indian PM's office denies Gujral has resigned.

text.p: The office of Indian Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral on Wednesday denied a stock market rumour that the leader had resigned.
"There is no basis, no truth in the rumours," a spokesman for the prime minister told Reuters by telephone.
Avinash Gupta, deputy general manager of the Delhi Stock Exchange, told Reuters he believed the rumour had helped drive down share prices on Indian exchanges.

At 3:58 p.m. (1028 GMT), the Bombay Stock Exchange's benchmark index was down 27.07 points, or 0.60 percent, at 4,520.95. Traders in Bombay said profit-taking had undermined share prices on that bourse.
On Wednesday afternoon, Gujral withdrew an insurance regulatory bill from the lower house of parliament after his government failed to muster enough votes to defeat an opposition-backed amendment.
Gupta said the setback could have fanned the rumour that Gujral had resigned.
